required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Ixekizumab (LY2439821) in Chinese Participants With Radiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind and Placebo-Controlled 16-Week Study Followed by Long Term Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Ixekizumab (LY2439821) in Chinese Patients With Radiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ixekizumab in Chinese participants with radiographic axial spondyloarthritis (r-axSpA).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving an Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society 40 (ASAS40) Response
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants Achieving an ASAS40 Response

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving an ASAS20 Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants Achieving an ASAS20 Response

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score (ASDAS)
Change from Baseline in Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index (BASDAI) Response
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in BASDAI Response

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Functional Index (BASFI)
Change from Baseline in Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the Spine (Spondyloarthritis Research Consortium of Canada [SPARCC] Score)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in MRI of the Spine (SPARCC Score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 36-Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in SF-36 PCS Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 36-Item SF-36 Mental Component Summary (MCS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in SF-36 MCS Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Measure of High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Measure of High Sensitivity CRP

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Mobility on the Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Metrology Index (BASMI)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Mobility on the BASMI

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Maastricht Ankylosing Spondylitis Enthesitis Score (MASES)
Change from Baseline in MRI Sacroiliac Joint(s) (SIJ) Spondyloarthritis Research Consortium of Canada (SPARCC) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in MRI SIJ SPARCC Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anterior Uveitis
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants With Anterior Uveitis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in ASAS-Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in ASAS-NSAID Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-Ixekizumab Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants With Anti-Ixekizumab Antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Trough Ixekizumab Concentration at Steady State (Ctrough ss)
secondary_outcome.description: PK: Trough Ixekizumab Concentration at Steady State (Ctrough ss)

arm_group.description: Ixekizumab given subcutaneously (SC) during the double-blind and extended treatment periods.
Placebo given SC during the double-blind period and then ixekizumab will be given SC during the extended treatment periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have an established diagnosis of radiographic axial spondyloarthritis (r-xSpA) with sacroiliitis defined radiographically according to the modified New York criteria.
- Participants have a history of back pain ≥3 months with age at onset <45 years.
- Biologic naïve or have had prior treatment with 1 tumor necrosis factor (TNF) inhibitor.
- Must have had an inadequate response to 2 or more NSAIDs at the therapeutic dose range for a total duration of at least 4 weeks OR have a history of intolerance to NSAIDs.
- Have a history of prior therapy for axSpa for at least 12 weeks prior to screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have total ankylosis of the spine.
- Have recently received a live vaccine within 12 weeks or have had a vaccination with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) within the past year.
- Have an ongoing or serious infection within the last 12 weeks.
- Have a compromised immune system.
- Have any other serious and/or uncontrolled diseases.
- Have either a current diagnosis or a recent history of malignant disease.
- Have had major surgery within 8 weeks of baseline, or will require surgery during the study.
- Are pregnant or breastfeeding.

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
